data.Sentence_cn: “卡蒂萨克”号帆船
data.Sentence: --- lesson 25  The Cutty Sark

data.Sentence_cn: 人们在格林威治仍可看到19世纪最有名的帆船之一“卡蒂萨克”号。
data.Sentence: One of the most famous sailing ships of the nineteenth century, the Cutty Sark, can still be seen at Greenwich.

data.Sentence_cn: 它停在陆地上，每年接待成千上万的参观者。
data.Sentence: She stands on dry land and is visited by thousands of people each year.

data.Sentence_cn: 它给人们留下深刻的印象，使人们回忆起历史上的巨型帆船，
data.Sentence: She serves as an impressive reminder of the great ships of the past.

data.Sentence_cn: 在蒸汽船取代帆船之前。“卡蒂萨克”号之类的帆船被用来从中国运回茶叶，从澳大利亚运回羊毛。
data.Sentence: Before they were replaced by steamships, sailing vessels like the Cutty Sark were used to carry tea from China and wool from Australia.

data.Sentence_cn: “卡蒂萨克”号是帆船制造史上建造的最快的一艘帆船。
data.Sentence: The Cutty Sark was one of the fastest sailing ships that has ever been built.

data.Sentence_cn: 唯一可以与之一比高低的是“塞姆皮雷”号帆船。
data.Sentence: The only other ship to match her was the Thermopylae.

data.Sentence_cn: 两船于1872年6月18日同时从上海启航驶往英国，途中展开了一场激烈的比赛。
data.Sentence: Both these ships set out from Shanghai on June 18th, 1872 on an exciting race to England.

data.Sentence_cn: 这场比赛持续了整整4个月，是这类比赛中的最后一次，
data.Sentence: This race, which went on for exactly four months, was the last of its kind.

data.Sentence_cn: 它标志着帆船伟大传统的结束与一个新纪元的开始。
data.Sentence: It marked the end of the great tradition of ships with sails and the beginning of a new era.

data.Sentence_cn: 比赛开始后，“赛姆皮雷”号率先抵达爪哇岛。但在印度洋上，“卡萨萨克”号驶到了前面。
data.Sentence: The first of the two ships to reach Java after the race had begun was the Thermopylae, but on the Indian Ocean, the Cutty Sark took the lead.

data.Sentence_cn: 看来，它首先返抵英国是确信无疑的了，但它却在比赛中连遭厄运。
data.Sentence: It seemed certain that she would be the first ship home, but during the race she had a lot of bad luck.

data.Sentence_cn: 8月份“卡蒂萨克”号遭到一场特大风暴的袭击，失去了一只舵。
data.Sentence: In August, she was struck by a very heavy storm during which her rudder was torn away.

data.Sentence_cn: 船身左右摇晃，无法操纵。
data.Sentence: The Cutty Sark rolled from side to side and it became impossible to steer her.

data.Sentence_cn: 船员用备用的木板在船上赶制了一只应急用的舵，并克服重重困难将舵安装就位，
data.Sentence: A temporary rudder was made on board from spare planks and it was fitted with great difficulty.

data.Sentence_cn: 这样一来，大大降低了船的航速。
data.Sentence: This greatly reduced the speed of the ship,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为船不能开得太快，否则就有危险，应急舵也会被刮走。
data.Sentence: for there was a danger that if she travelled too quickly, this rudder would be torn away as well.

data.Sentence_cn: 因为这个缘故，“卡蒂萨克”号落到了后面。
data.Sentence: Because of this, the Cutty Sark lost her lead.

data.Sentence_cn: 跨越赤道后，船长将船停靠在一个港口，在那儿换了一只舵。
data.Sentence: After crossing the Equator, the captain called in at a port to have a new rudder fitted,

data.Sentence_cn: 但此时，“赛姆皮雷”号早已在500多英里之遥了。
data.Sentence: but by now the Thermopylae was over five hundred miles ahead.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管换装新舵时分秒必争，但“卡蒂萨克”号已经不可能取胜了，
data.Sentence: Though the new rudder was fitted at tremendous speed, it was impossible for the Cutty Sark to win.

data.Sentence_cn: 它抵达英国时比“塞姆皮雷”号晚了1个星期。
data.Sentence: She arrived in England a week after the Thermopylae.

data.Sentence_cn: 但考虑到路上的多次耽搁，
data.Sentence: Even this was remarkable, considering that she had had so many delays.

data.Sentence_cn: 这个成绩也已很不容易了。毫无疑问，如果中途没有失去舵， “卡帝萨克”号肯定能在比赛中轻易夺冠。
data.Sentence: There is no doubt that if she had not lost her rudder she would have won the race easily.
